item.title: Linux Introduction
item.description: Linux is a computer operating system. An operating system consists of the software that manages your computer and lets you run application on it. The features that make up Linux and similar computer operating systems include the following. Detecting and preparing hardware When you turn on your computer, the Linux system will boot up and loads the software (drivers and modules) needed to access those particular hardware devices.
